GET STARTED

About software escrow verification

Deposit

Though software developers make escrow deposits with the best of intentions, escrow materials can sometimes contain files or data that are corrupted, incomplete, password-protected, difficult to use, or even contain viruses.

Verify

Different levels of technical verification are used to validate the completeness, accuracy, and usability of materials deposited into escrow as assurance that the beneficiary's investment is protected.

Release

Verification is used to validate the completeness, accuracy, and usability of materials deposited into escrow. It’s the only way of being certain that, in case of a release event, the beneficiary will be able to effectively use their developer’s source code in-house or transition to a new supplier effortlessly.

Codekeeper verification solutions

The level of verification that’s right for you depends on your budget, risk tolerance, and degree of customization of the software. At Codekeeper, we offer four levels of verification to ensure that all parties to the escrow agreement get the level of protection they need.

We are also able to add other verification services outside of our standard offering and execute bespoke solutions for our enterprise clients upon request. Simply send us your requirements, and we will design a verification process that’s right for you.

Need a custom verification process?

Contact us

Verification Micro

Our micro verification option includes an escrow content inspection report, including source code and any other data. This option also includes a review of development activity on the source code, and it’s a good starting point for companies that are simply looking to ensure that materials deposited in escrow are complete and up-to-date.

GET STARTED

Verification Basic

Our basic verification option gives you a thorough code inspection, including source code, configuration materials, and other supporting documentation. This option is great for companies that want to validate the completeness and accuracy of escrowed materials to ensure they have everything they need to update the software application, without assistance from the licensor.

GET STARTED

Verification Advanced

Our advanced verification option includes all the features of basic verification, in addition to installing your software application and running an operational version of the software. Companies for which it is imperative to ensure continuity in case of a release event often pick this option to validate not only the completeness and accuracy of materials deposited in escrow but also that the application runs as expected.

GET STARTED

Verification Complete

Our complete verification option includes all advanced verification features, plus testing up to 20 key features* of your software. Though the goal here is not to conduct a full acceptance test of the software, this option is great for companies that want to minimize the chance of disruption to or delay in business operations by detecting any potential issues preemptively. It ensures that the beneficiary will be able to effectively use the application immediately and avoid any ramifications of losing access to mission-critical software.

*A feature can be anything contained in the source code; some examples of what this means include: the application sends an email confirmation, it has a working email signup process, the user is able to upload a file, and so on.*
